disease_explanation: A type of high blood pressure affecting arteries in the lungs and the heart.
treatment: blood tests, chest X-ray, or echocardiogram
treatment_explanation: These tests evaluate lung and heart function and identify structural abnormalities.

disease_explanation: Chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart.
treatment_explanation: A stress test evaluates heart performance under stress, while angiography visualizes blood flow.

disease_explanation: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes leading to coughing and mucus production.
treatment_explanation: These tests help assess inflammation in the airways.

disease_explanation: A chronic autoimmune disorder that causes inflammation and pain in the joints.
treatment: physical exam, blood tests, or imaging tests
treatment_explanation: These tests help identify the extent of joint damage and inflammation.

disease_explanation: A chronic skin condition characterized by dry, itchy, and inflamed skin.
treatment_explanation: A physical exam or skin biopsy helps identify the type and severity of eczema.

disease_explanation: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.
treatment_explanation: An EEG measures electrical activity in the brain, while imaging tests help identify structural abnormalities.

disease_explanation: A progressive neurological disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior.
treatment_explanation: A clinical evaluation assesses cognitive function, while imaging tests help identify structural changes in the brain.

disease_explanation: A metabolic disorder characterized by high blood sugar levels.
treatment_explanation: Blood tests measure blood glucose levels to diagnose diabetes.

disease_explanation: Inflammation of the appendix, which can cause severe abdominal pain.
treatment: physical exam, blood tests, or imaging tests
treatment_explanation: These tests help identify the location and severity of the inflammation.

disease_explanation: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
treatment: clinical evaluation or rapid influenza diagnostic tests
treatment_explanation: These tests confirm the presence of influenza virus in the body.

disease_explanation: An infection in any part of the urinary system, often caused by bacteria.
treatment_explanation: Tests analyze urine for bacteria or infection markers.

disease_explanation: A condition characterized by a lack of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood.
treatment_explanation: Blood tests measure red blood cell count, hemoglobin, and other factors to diagnose anemia.

disease_explanation: Clouding of the eye lens, leading to decreased vision.
treatment_explanation: A comprehensive eye exam assesses lens clarity.

disease_explanation: A neurological condition characterized by intense headaches often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light.
treatment_explanation: Clinical evaluation identifies patterns, while MRI rules out other causes.

disease_explanation: A type of cancer that begins in the lymphatic system.
treatment_explanation: A biopsy examines lymphatic tissue for cancer cells.

disease_explanation: A cancer that develops in the esophagus, making swallowing difficult.
treatment_explanation: Endoscopy visualizes the esophagus, and a biopsy confirms the presence of cancer cells.

disease_explanation: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the digestive tract.
treatment_explanation: Colonoscopy examines the bowel, and blood tests detect inflammation markers.

disease_explanation: A blood clot forms in a deep vein, usually in the legs, causing swelling and pain.
treatment_explanation: An ultrasound detects clots, and blood tests identify clotting abnormalities.

disease_explanation: Damage to peripheral nerves causes weakness, numbness, and pain in extremities.
treatment: nerve conduction studies or blood tests
treatment_explanation: These tests measure nerve function and detect underlying causes.

disease_explanation: A condition where bones become weak and brittle, increasing fracture risk.
treatment_explanation: A scan measures bone strength and detects osteoporosis.

disease_explanation: A rare condition causing imbalance in body fluids and excessive thirst.
treatment_explanation: This test measures the body's ability to conserve water.

disease_explanation: A condition caused by excess bilirubin in the blood, indicating liver issues.
treatment_explanation: Tests measure bilirubin and enzyme levels to assess liver health.

disease_explanation: A rare genetic disorder affecting blood clotting ability.
treatment_explanation: Tests measure clotting factor levels to diagnose hemophilia.

disease_explanation: A condition where the thyroid gland produces insufficient hormones.
treatment_explanation: The test measures thyroid-stimulating hormone levels.

disease_explanation: A chronic condition causing airway inflammation and narrowing.
treatment_explanation: These tests measure lung function and airway obstruction.

disease_explanation: Cancer affecting the colon or rectum, often detected through bleeding.
treatment_explanation: Colonoscopy examines the bowel, while stool tests detect hidden blood.

disease_explanation: Inflammation of the tonsils, usually due to infection.
treatment_explanation: Tests identify bacterial or viral infection causing tonsillitis.

disease_explanation: A heart condition causing irregular and often rapid heartbeat.
treatment_explanation: These tests record heart rhythm to detect abnormalities.

disease_explanation: A condition where kidney function is impaired.
treatment_explanation: Tests measure waste and electrolyte levels in urine and blood.

disease_explanation: An autoimmune disorder causing dryness in the mouth and eyes.
treatment_explanation: These tests detect autoantibodies and confirm glandular damage.
